radiographic_examinations.findings: Extensive periventricular white-matter hypodensities and focal occlusion of the distal right vertebral artery near the vertebrobasilar junction. A rounded soft-tissue mass (1.6 cm in diameter) in the region of the left cavernous sinus with a 4-mm enhancing focus thought to be a thrombosed aneurysm.
Bilateral small pleural effusions, bibasilar atelectasis, mild enlargement of the cardiomediastinal silhouette, tortuous and calcified thoracic aorta, and diffuse osteopenia.
Infiltrate in the lower lobe of the right lung.
Bilateral basilar opacities consistent with atelectasis, aspiration pneumonia, or both, along with changes consistent with mild interstitial edema.
